subtitle: The tortellini can be cooked in the microwave but, if preferred, can also be cooked conventionally in plenty of salted water on the hob while you prepare the sauce in the microwave.

method.text: Place the tortellini in a very large casserole dish. Pour on boiling water to cover well. Season. Add half the oil. Cover and bring to the boil on 100% (FULL) power. (Watch all the time. If beginning to boil over, remove the cover.) Reduce to 50% (MEDIUM) power. Cook for 5 min. Leave to stand.
Melt the butter in a shallow dish on 100% (FULL) power for 1 - 1 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> min, add the Prosciutto (or cooked ham) and cook, uncovered, for 1-2 min.

Add the cream. Heat for 3-4 min, stirring occasionally. Reduce to 50% (MEDIUM) power. Cook for 6-8 min to reduce the liquid down by about <sup>1</sup>/<sub>3</sub>, stirring frequently. Season to taste.
Meanwhile, drain the pasta thoroughly. Add the remaining oil, tossing over well to avoid sticking.
Spoon the pasta into a warmed serving dish. Pour the sauce over and toss gently. Garnish with a sprinkling of freshly grated Parmesan cheese and serve.

title: Tortellini verdi with prosciutto and cream - microwave
